siteMetadata.title: rantum.dev
siteMetadata.subtitle: digital dwelling of andrew maury. digital developer @ecomloop in burlingame, ca. san matean nantucketer on a rantum scoot.

frontmatter.title: Simplify paths
frontmatter.description: Simplify paths by eliminating distractions. Get rid of the extraneous, and make the next step clear. Paths are effective because they are a clear way through an otherwise difficult crossing.

frontmatter.title: Focus don't react
frontmatter.description: back to school arrives // loosening grasp of control //focus don't react

frontmatter.title: Task at hand
frontmatter.description: It's easy to lose focus and become distracted. Real changes have occurred, causing plans to change. Adjust, reassess, then focus on the task at hand.

frontmatter.title: Dictate morning attention
frontmatter.description: Mornings shouldn't be left up to others to dictate. Put effort into dictating what gets attention in the mornings by not relying on newsfeeds.

frontmatter.title: Be diligent with healthy routines
frontmatter.description: Focus on consistency and quality will follow.

frontmatter.title: Small tasks unattended become distractions
frontmatter.description: Make time to handle these small tasks before they become distractions from the important matters.

frontmatter.title: Move projects forward with fresh perspectives
frontmatter.description: Revise requirements as new information becomes available. Don't assume the original path is the only way forward.

frontmatter.title: Make regular time to declutter mind
frontmatter.description: Make regular time to declutter mind. It's worth the time and having a regular time makes it easier to trust those distractions will be addressed.

frontmatter.title: Declutter mind to address anxieties
frontmatter.description: When the world changes drastically, the mind can become decluttered easily. There's a lot to process and there are many changes, some readily apparently and others in the subconcious.

frontmatter.title: Use tools with a purpose
frontmatter.description: Tools are only tools if they are being used with a purposed. When used haphazardly, tools are easily changed to distractions.
